name: Notice to Borrower Prospective Borrower
description:
This is Indiana form HPU-01 from the Office of the Indiana Attorney General Homeowner Protection Unit. 

This document states that a creditor shall, not later than three (3) business days after receiving a completed written application for a mortgage loan from a borrower or prospective borrower, provide to the borrower or prospective borrower a notice, on a form prescribed by the homeowner protection unit under subsection (b),that includes the following: 

(1) Contact information for the homeowner protection unit established by the attorney general under IC 4-6-12, including: 

(A) an electronic mail address for the homeowner protection unit; and (B) the toll free telephone number described in IC 4-6-12-3.5.

(2) A statement that the borrower or prospective borrower may contact the homeowner protection unit to report: 

(A) a suspected violation of section 7 of this chapter; or 

(B) other information about suspected fraudulent residential real estate transactions, as authorized by IC 4-6-12-3.5(b).

(3) A statement that the borrower in a real estate transaction that involves the making, refinancing, or consolidation of a mortgage loan has the right to inspect the HUD-1 or HUD-1A settlement statement during the business day immediately  preceding settlement, as provided by the federal Real Estate Settlement Procedures Act (12 U.S.C. 2601 et seq.), as amended. The creditor shall provide the notice required by this subsection by delivering it to the borrower or prospective borrower or placing it in the United States mail to the borrower or prospective borrower within the time prescribed by this subsection.

name: Statement of Purpose
description: To provide information required by the government where a loan is secured directly or indirectly by margin stock. Margin stock is defined in Reg U (12 CFR 221) as stocks that are registered on a national securities exchange or any OTC security designated for trading in the National Market System; or debt securities (bonds) that are convertible into margin stock; or shares of most mutual funds. Form is used in compliance with Regulation G which in 1998 was folded into Reg U.  This form is to be used by non-banks.  Banks utilize CSi form 302.

name: Mortgage Awareness Program Notice
description: This form is to be given to applicant at the time of loan application to notify the applicant that they have the right to participate in a loan counseling and educational program (prior to signing for the loan), known as the Mortgage Awareness Program.  This form also indicates where the applicant can obtain information regarding this program.

name: Public Information Notice
description:
A. Statute requires from all financial institutions, mortgagees, lenders, business entities and organizations without limitation, who intend to use the power of sale foreclosure, to provide Public Information Notice to the public, upon request, and to any applicant submitting a loan application where residential property is required to be used to secure the loan. The notice shall be provided to all applicants and all owners of the residential property (if different from the applicants) within three business days after the submission of a written loan application, or within three business days after the time residential property is required to be used to secure a loan, whether or not there is a written loan application.

B. The purpose of the public information notice is to inform the public, applicants, and others that the financial institutions, mortgagees, lenders, organizations, and other business entities and persons who are authorized under this part to enforce the foreclosure rights in a mortgage, in the event of the borrower's default, have the option of pursuing either a judicial or non-judicial foreclosure in the manner provided by law. The public information notice requirement shall be satisfied by the delivery of a separate notice that is printed in not less than fourteen-point font.

C.  The requirements of section  667-41 shall apply only to written loan applications submitted, or to loans where residential property is required to be used as security, after August 31, 2012.

name: Waiver of Participation in Mortgage Awareness Program
description: This form indicates that the mortgage loan applicant has received the Mortgage Awareness Program Notice at the time of application (prior to signing for the loan) and the applicant is waiving the right to participate in the program by signing this form.

name: Certificate of Gross Retail or Use Tax Exemption for Motor Vehicle or Watercraft
description:
INDIANA CODE 6-2.5-9-6 requires that a person titling a vehicle or watercraft present certification indicating the state gross sales and use
tax has been paid. However, if an exemption from the tax is claimed, the purchaser and the dealer must complete Form ST-108E and submit it to the license branch at the time of licensing. 
ST-108E serves as an affidavit of exemption by the purchaser and lists the exemptions available to qualified purchases.

name: Michigan Mailing Certificate of Title
description: The owner of the vehicle or watercraft may direct the Michigan Department of State to mail or release his/her new title to the party listed in this form. However, if this party is a lien holder, any duplicate title will also be sent to the lien holder until the lien is terminated. This form will accompany title application.

name: Estimated Settlement Costs and Refundability Disclosure
description: This eDoc is used as a disclosure for estimated settlement costs and refundability of fees that are likely to incur in connection with consumer mortgage loan. These state specific disclosure requirements are distinct from those required under the RESPA regulations.

name: Application for Motor Vehicle Temporary Lien
description:
The Motor Vehicle Temporary Lien Program began on July 1, 1998. This program establishes a procedure in the Office of the Secretary of State for temporarily recording a lien on a motor vehicle
prior to the issuance by the Department of Revenue of a certificate of title evidencing that lien.

The proper filing of such a document with the Division of Business Services constitutes constructive notice of the lien against the motor vehicle described therein to creditors of the owner, subsequent purchasers
and encumbrances, except liens that are by law dependent on possession.

Constructive notice is effective from the time of the filing of the document creating and evidencing the lien.

A temporary lien properly filed with the Division of Business Services automatically terminates after 180 days or upon being otherwise perfected, whichever occurs first.
After 270 days, the temporary lien documents are purged from the filing system and destroyed.

name: Real Property Recordation and Transfer Tax Form FP 7/C
description: The purpose of the form is to determine the transfer, recordation and filing of any deeds.  This form must accompany all filings where there is a conveyance of any interest in any real property.

name: Affidavit Addendum (FP7CA)
description: This form is an extension of the D.C. Real Property Recordation and Transfer Tax Form FP7/C and is used if extra space is required for signatures. This form must be attached to the D.C. Real Property Recordation and Transfer Tax Form FP7/C.

name: Security Affidavit - Class 1
description: This is the sister form to the D.C. Real Property Recordation and Transfer Tax Form FP7/C. By signing this form, the borrower is stating that the underlying property is Class 1 property and therefore qualifies as an exemption to the recordation tax relate

name: UCC Financing Statement Property Description Addendum
description: UCC Financing Statement Property Description Addendum

name: Maximum Interest Rate Payment Example Disclosure
description: This is a disclosure for principal-dwelling secured home equity line of credit to be furnished on or before the loan closing date.  Disclosure provides an example of the maximum monthly interest payment based on the consumer's loan, as required by RI Statutes Section 6-27-11.

name: Disclosure of Homeowner Counseling Organizations
description: This a placeholder document that is returned out of the DSL to inform financial institutions that effective January 10, 2014, they must provide applicants a written disclosure that contains a clear and conspicuous list of federally certified homeownership counseling organizations that provide relevant counseling services in the applicant's location.  This requirement applies to all loans covered by RESPA (which includes most loans secured by a lien on a dwelling) and the disclosure must be provided no later than three business days after a financial institution receives an application.  As of November 4, 2013, the CFPB has not yet published the webpage where such information will be located.  Financial institutions must check for updates at www.consumerfinance.gov/regulatory-implementation/ and www.consumerfinance.gov for information regarding the location of the CFPB website and information necessary to complete the required disclosure.

name: Request for Copy of Tax Form
description: To request a copy of current and past income tax filings.

name: Interim Homeownership Counseling Disclosure
description: This is an interim document used to inform financial institutions that effective January 10, 2014, they must provide applicants a written disclosure that contains a clear and conspicuous list of federally certified homeownership counseling organizations that provide relevant counseling services in the applicant's location.  This requirement applies to all loans covered by RESPA (which includes most loans secured by a lien on a dwelling) and the disclosure must be provided no later than three business days after a financial institution receives an application.  There is a six month interim compliance period in which this document may be used instead of 449BA - Disclosure of Homeowner Counseling Organizations.  The six month interim compliance period is effective from November 8th, 2013 to May 8th, 2014.

name: Hazard Insurance Disclosure
description: This is a disclosure document that is required to be given to the Borrower at the time of application.  It discloses that Borrower is not required to obtain property hazard insurance on the property that is securing the loan.  Upon signing, Borrower ackno

description: Notification of a security interest in branded livestock

name: Waiver of Garnishment Protection
description:
This form is used to waive the garnishment protection that Florida law provides to Debtor that is classified as “Head of family” and it is related with his/her disposable earnings.
Disposable earnings of a person other than a head of family may not be attached or garnished in excess of the amount allowed under (federal law) the Consumer Credit Protection Act, 15 U.S.C. s. 1673

name: Direct Deposit Sign-Up Form
description: To sign up a customer/member for direct deposit of a recurring government payment, such as a social security check.

name: Remittance Transfer Combined Disclosure
description: provide transfer details disclosure, with error dispute and cancellation rights for Sender. Remittance Transfers are consumer transfers for personal, family, or household purposes, to be received at a location in another country. Disclosure and receipt forms are required by 12 CFR Chapter X, Part 1005- Electronic Fund Transfers (Regulation E), Subpart B- Requirements for Remittance Transfers.

name: W-7, Application for IRS Individual Taxpayer Identification Number
description: To apply for IRS individual taxpayer identification number (ITIN). For individuals who are required to have a U.S. taxpayer identification number but who do not have, and are not eligible to obtain, a social security number (SSN).

name: W-8BEN, Certificate of Foreign Status of Beneficial Owner for US Tax Withholding
description: To document certification of foreign status regarding tax withholding. Form W-8BEN is used to establish identity as foreign person, establish claim as beneficial owner of income, or claim a reduced rate of, or exemption from, withholding as a resident of a foreign country with which the U.S. has an income treaty. Also to claim exception from domestic information reporting and backup withholding.

name: W-8ECI, Certificate of Foreign Person's Claim That Income is Effectively Connected
description: To document claim for exemption from withholding on income effectively connected with the conduct of a trade or business in the United States, by foreign person or entity.

name: W-8IMY, Certificate Of Foreign Intermediary, Foreign Partnership, Or Certain US
description: To document certification by a foreign intermediary, foreign partnership, or certain U.S. branches for United States Tax Withholding, for establishing status as intermediary not beneficial owner. Further uses and directions supplied in instructions, which are included with form.

name: W-8EXP, Certificate of Foreign Government or Other Foreign Organization
description: To document certification by a foreign government or international organization which establishes foreign status, establishes claim as beneficial owner, and makes claim for at least a partial reduction in tax withholding. Form includes W-8EXP and instructions.

name: SS-4, Application for Employer Identification Number
description: To apply for an employer identification number [EIN] by employers, corporations, partnerships, trusts, estates, churches, government agencies, certain individuals, and others, as required.

name: W-8BEN, Instructions for Form Certificate of Foreign Status of Beneficial Owner
description: To document certification of foreign status regarding tax withholding. Form W-8BEN is used to establish identity as foreign person, establish claim as beneficial owner of income, or claim a reduced rate of, or exemption from, withholding as a resident of a foreign country with which the U.S. has an income treaty. Also to claim exception from domestic information reporting and backup withholding. The use and directions for the W-8BEN are provided by these instructions.

name: W-8ECI, Instructions for Form Certificate of Foreign Person's Claim for exemption
description: To document claim for exemption from withholding on income effectively connected with the conduct of a trade or business in the United States, by foreign person or entity.  The uses and directions for the W-8ECI are provided by these instructions.

name: W-8IMY, Instruction for Form Certificate of Foreign Intermediary, Foreign Partner
description: To document certification by a foreign intermediary, foreign partnership, or certain U.S. branches for United States Tax Withholding, for establishing status as intermediary not beneficial owner. Further uses and directions for the W-8IMY supplied in these instructions.

name: W-8EXP, Instruction for Form Certificate of Foreign Government or Other Foreign
description: To document certification by a foreign government or international organization which establishes foreign status, establishes claim as beneficial owner, and makes claim for at least a partial reduction in tax withholding. Form includes W-8EXP and instructions.

name: Instructions for Form SS-4
description: To provide instructions for completing Form SS-4, Application for Employer Identification Number.

name: EqualEmploymentOpportunityPoster
description: This document is required to be included in the Closing Documents for an SBA 7(a) loan transaction.  The document is used to express the non-discrimination employment policies of the Small Business Loan Borrower.

name: SBASettlementSheet
description: This document is required to be included in the Closing Documents for an SBA 7(a) loan transaction.  The document includes covenants that the Lender and Borrower must attest to, such as:  1. the loan funds were disbursed and received and will be used in accordance with the Use of Proceeds section of the Authorization; 2. there are no liens or encumbrances against the real or personal property securing the loan except those disclosed in the application; and 3) there has been no adverse change in the Borrower's or Operating Company's financial condition since the date of the application.  The SBASettlementSheet must be signed by both the Borrower and the Lender.

name: SBAFeeDisclosureAndCompensationAgreement
description: The SBA Fee Disclosure and Compensation Agreement was created to be called at application when the applicant or business paid someone for assisting in preparing the loan application or for referring the loan to the lender.  Information on this form is used to monitor the agents, fees charged by agents, and the relationship between agents and lenders.

name: SBAAgreementOfCompliance
description: This form is an agreement of compliance with Executive Order 11246 which prohibits discrimination because of race, color, religion, sex, or national origin and requires affirmative action to ensure equality of opportunity in all aspects of employment by contractors and subcontractors performing work under a federally assisted construction in excess of $10,000.

name: SBAStatementOfPersonalHistory
description:
If a Subject Individual answers "yes" to question 2 or 3 on SBA Form 1919 (relating to arrests and criminal convictions), that individual must complete the SBA
Statement of Personal History.  This form is used to accomplish a background check and character determination.

name: SBAStatementRegardingLobbying
description: This form includes a sworn statement used to guarantee that if funds have been paid or will be paid to a federal employee or member of Congress in connection with the commitment to insure or guarantee a loan, the "Disclosure of Lobbying Activities" form will be completed and submitted as required.  This form is required for all standard 7(a) loan applications over $350,000.

name: SBABorrowerInformationForm
description: The SBA Borrower Information Form was created to be called at application and is required for all SBA 7(a) loans.  The purpose of this document is to collect identifying information about the applicant, the loan request, the principals, and current and/or previous government financing.

name: SBAReligiousEligibilityWorksheet
description: The purpose of this document is to collect information used to determine whether a religiously affiliated organization is eligible to receive an SBA guaranteed commercial loan.  In evaluating the eligibility of a Small Business Applicant, if it appears that the Small Business Applicant may be connected, associated, or affiliated with a religious organization or may have a religious component, the lender must complete the Religious Eligibility Worksheet.    This form is to be modeled after SBA Form 1971.

name: SBAApplicationForGuaranty
description: This document was created to be called at application and used to support SBA 7(a) commercial loan transactions.  The purpose of this form is to collect identifying information regarding the lender, the loan terms, the use of proceeds, the number of jobs created or retained, and other applicant eligibility information.

name: SBAStandbyCreditorAgreement
description: The purpose of this form is to restrict borrower's payment to other creditors.  A Standby Creditor must subordinate any lien rights in collateral securing the Loan to lender's rights in the collateral, and take no action against Borrower or any collateral securing the Standby Debt without lender's consent.  This form is to be modeled after SBA Form 155.

name: SBAApplicationChecklistAndCoverSheet
description: This document includes a coversheet lenders may use to assist and preparing an application for loan guaranty.  This document also includes a coversheet which may be used when submitting the respective application.

name: Security Instrument Cover Sheet
description: The Security Instrument Cover Sheet is used to conform to specific recording statutes that require certain information be included on the first page of the recorded instrument.  This cover sheet currently accompanies the security instrument when the pledged real estate collateral is located in the following states:  Iowa (I.C.A. 331.606B ); Missouri (MO ST 59.310); Oregon (ORS 205.234); Virginia (VA ST -  17.1-227.1); and Washington (RCW 65.04.047)

name: Notice About Flood Insurance Coverage
description: This is lenders placed insurance during the term of designated loan, when lender determinates that the loan is not covered by flood insurance or if the flood insurance coverage is insufficient under applicable guidelines for the National Flood Insurance Program. The Notice About Flood Insurance Coverage must be provided to the applicant/owner requiring to obtain the necessary amount of of flood insurance prior to the forced placement of insurance. Required  by the Massachusetts law.

name: Home Loan Toolkit
description: The Home Loan Toolkit is a consumer guide that is designed to replace the current Settlement Cost Booklet when the TILA-RESPA Integrated Disclosures go into effect on August 1, 2015.  This document will replace the Settlement Cost Booklet (aka Special Information Booklet) in transactions where TRID is applicable.  The user will have the option of returning a placeholder, the actual Toolkit PDF, or both.
